Name: Eagle-eye Bolt Thrower
Description:
R: 24"
S: 5
AP: -3
Special Rules: Cumbersome, Multiple Wounds (D3)
Notes: -

Name: Horn of Isha
Description: Description: Single use. During the Command sub-phase of their turn, this character may attempt to use the Horn of Isha by making a Leadership test (using their own Leadership). If this test is passed, until your next Start of Turn sub-phase, this character and any unit they have joined gain a +1 modifier to both their rolls To Hit and their rolls To Wound.

Name: Loremaster
Description:
Description: High Elf Lords only. A character with the Loremaster Elven Honour:
- Cannot be mounted
- Is a Level 1 Wizard and knows one randomly generated spell from one of the following Lores of Magic: Battle Magic Elementalism High Magic Illusion
- May be equipped with a Sword of Hoeth for no additional points. If so, they may not take any additional, non-magical weapons.
- Gains the Ithlmar Armour, Lileath´s Blessing and Lore of Saphery special rules.

Name: Shadow Stalker
Description:
Description: A character with the Shadow Stalker Elven Honour:
- Cannot be mounted
- May de equipped with a bow of Avelorn for no additional points. If so, they may not take any additional, non-magical weapons.
- Cannot have heavy armour or full plate armour
- Gains the Ambushers, Evasive, Fire & Flee, Move through Cover and Scout special rule.

Name: Anointed of Asuryan
Description:
Description: A character with the Anointed of Asurnyan Elven Honour:
- May be mounted on a Flamespyre or a Frostheart Phoenix (but cannot choose any other mount option).
- May be equipped with a ceremonial halberd for no additional points. If so, they may not take any additional, non-magical weapons.
- Gains the Blessings of Asuryan, Fear and Witness to Destiny special rules.
- Replaces the Valour of Ages special rule with the Veteran special rule.

Name: Blood Of Caledor
Description:
Description: A character with the Blood of Caledor Elven Honour (but not their mount):
- Must be mounted on either a Barded Elven Steed, a Sun Dragon, a Moon Dragon, or a Star Dragon.
- Has a +1 modifier to their Weapon Skill characteristic.
- May be equipped with full plate armour for no additional points.
- Gains the Dragon Armour and Impetuous special rules.

Name: Chracian Hunter
Description:
Description: A character with the Chracian Hunter Elven Honour (but not their mount):
- May only be mounted on a White Lion Chariot (but cannot choose any other mount options).
- May be equipped with a Chracian great blade for no additional points, If so, they may not take any additional, non-magical weapons.
- Gains the Lion Cloak, Move through Cover and Stubborn special rules.

Name: Warden of Saphery
Description:
Description: A character with the Warden of Saphery Elven Honour:
- Cannot be mounted.
- May be equipped with a Sword of Hoeth for no additional points. If so, they may not take any additional, non-magical weapons.
- Gains the Deflect Shots, Ithilmar Armour and Killing Blow special rules.

Name: Pure of Heart
Description: Description: Unless this character is fleeing, all friendly units within their Command range can use their Leadership characteristic instead of their own. In addition, this character and any unit it has joined automatically passes any Panic test it is required to make.

Name: Sea Guard
Description:
Description: A character with the Sea Guard Elven Honour:
- May only be mounted on a Lothern Skycutter (but cannot choose any other mount options).
- May be equipped with a warbow for no additional points. If so, they may not take any additional, non-magical weapons.
- Gains the Naval Discipline and Rallying Cry special rules.

Name: Immovable Object
Description:
Description: Once a Field Trebuchet has been placed on the battlefield during deployment, it cannot be moved by its crew during the Remaining moves sub-phase.

 
Note that a Field Trebuchet can still pivot freely at any time during its turn, and may make a follow up move as normal.

Name: Grail Monk
Description: Description: A Grail Monk is a command group model that follows all of the rules for a champion. In other words, a unit that contains both a Yeoman and a Grail Monk contains two champions.

Name: Blessed Triptych
Description: Description: A unit that contains a model equipped with a Blessed Triptych gains the Stubborn special rule.

Name: Burning Braziers
Description: Description: The longbows of a unit equipped with burning braziers gain the Flaming Attacks special rule.

Name: Defensive Stakes
Description:
Description: When a unit equipped with defensive stakes is deployed, the stakes are placed in base contact with its front arc and will remain there for the duration of the game, unless the unit moves – should the unit move for any reason (including reforming), the stakes are lost and are removed from play. All measurement to and from the unit is done from the unit itself – ignore the stakes.

Enemy units can charge the front of a unit equipped with defensive stakes as normal but do not have to physically cross the stakes to do so. Instead, the front rank of a charging unit moves into base contact with the stakes, making a disordered charge and becoming Disrupted. A model whose troop type is ‘cavalry’ or ‘chariot’ must make a Dangerous Terrain test if it ends its charge move in base contact with the stakes.

Name: Grail Reliquae
Description:
Description: The Grail Reliquae is placed in the centre of the front rank of its unit (or as close to the centre as possible) and occupies the space of, and counts as, six models; two in the front rank, two in the second and two in the third. If the unit turns or reforms, the Grail Reliquae must be repositioned into the new front rank.

Casualties are removed from the unit as normal, but the Grail Reliquae cannot lose any Wounds whilst any Battle Pilgrims remain. Only once all of the Battle Pilgrims have been removed from the unit can the Grail Reliquae itself lose Wounds.

The Grail Reliquae counts as both a standard bearer and a musician for its unit. Whilst the Grail Reliquae model itself is within 12" of a friendly model that has the Grail Vow and is not fleeing, its unit gains the Immune to Psychology and Unbreakable special rules.

Name: Retinue of the Saints
Description: Description: Your army may include up to one Grail Reliquae for every character or unit with the Grail Vow it includes.

Name: Virtue of Knightly Temper
Description: Description: During a turn in which it charged, a model with this Virtue gains the Extra Attacks (+D3) and Hatred (all enemies) special rule.

Name: Virtue of Heroism
Description: Description: Unless using a magic weapon, a model with rhis Virtue gains the Killing Blow and Monster Slayer special rules.

Name: Virtue of Stoicism
Description: Description: A model with this Virtue (and its unit) may re-roll the 2D6 when making a Break test.

Name: Virtue of The Impetuous Knight
Description: Description: A model with this Virtue gains the Impetuous special rule. In addition, this model (and its unit) increases ots maximum possible charge range by 3". Finaly, when this model (and its unit) makes a Charge roll, you may apply a +D3 modifier to the result.

Name: Virtue of The Ideal
Description: Description: Duke, Baron or Paladin only. A character with this Virtue has a +1 modifier to its Weapon Skill, Initiative, Attacks and Leadership characteristic. However, this character cannot be your army´s General or join a friendly unit.

Name: Virtue of Duty
Description: Description: Duke, Baron or Paladin only. Unless the General of their army has been removed from play as a casualty, when calculating its combat result, this character may claim a bonus of +1 combat result point. This character cannot be your army General or join a friendly unit.

Name: Virtue of Audacity
Description: Description: A model with this Virtue may re-roll any failed rolls To Hit made against an enemy model with a higher Weapon Skill characteristic than it.

Name: Virtue of Purity
Description: Description: A model with this Virtue always benefits from the Blessings of the Lady special rule and always has a +5 Ward save, even if this model´s army did not pray at the start of the game.

Name: Virtue of The Penitent
Description: Description: Duke, Baron or Paladin only. A character with this Virtue gains the Unbreakable special rule. However, this character cannot join a friendly unit.

Name: Virtue of Discipline
Description: Description: A model with this Virtue (and its unit) can march whilst within 8" of an enemy unit without first having to make a Leadership test.

Name: Virtue of Confidence
Description: Description: A model with this Virtue always issue and accept challenges (if possible). During a challenge, this model may re-roll any failed rolls To Hit.

Name: Virtue of Noble Disdain
Description: Description: A model with this Virtue may re-roll any failed rolls To Hit made during the first round of combat when engaged with an enemy equipped with any missile weapons.

Name: Virtue of The Joust
Description: Description: A model with this Virtue may re-roll any failed rolls To Wound made when using a lance.

Name: Virtue of Empathy
Description: Description: Duke, Baron or Paladin only. A character with this Virtue join a unit with the Peasantry special rule.

Name: Banished Lords
Description:
Description: Barons and Paladins within a Bretonnian Exiles army cannot have the Grail Vow.


However, the following characters and units may replace the Knight’s Vow with the Exile’s Vow for free:


• Baron or Paladin 
• Knights of the Realm on Foot 
• Knights Errant 
• Mounted Knights of the Realm 
• Pegasus Knights

Name: Reclaimed Glory
Description:
Description: A Bretonnian Exiles army cannot pray for the Blessings of the Lady at the beginning of the game. However, should a unit with the Blessings of the Lady special rule make an overrun move or make contact with a fleeing enemy unit during a charge or pursuit move, that unit will immediately gain the benefits of the Blessings of the Lady special rule as if it had prayed at the start of the game. Additionally, should a character with the Blessings of the Lady special rule kill an enemy character in a challenge, they (and any unit they have joined) will immediately gain the benefits of the Blessings of the Lady special rule.


However, should the benefits of the Blessing of the Lady special rule be lost during a game, they cannot be regained again in this way.

Name: Blunderbuss
Description:
R: 12"
S: 3
AP: -1
Special Rules: Multiple Shots (D3), Volley Fire
Notes: A model armed with a blunderbuss suffers no negative modifiers for firing at long range, for using the Multiple Shots (D3) special rule, or whilst making a Stand & Shoot charge reaction.

Name: The Crusader's Vow
Description:
Description: The Crusader’s Vow is a Chivalrous Vow. A model with this Chivalrous Vow has the Veteran special rule. In addition, a model with this Chivalrous Vow does not have to make a Panic test when a friendly unit with the Peasantry special rule is destroyed whilst within 6" of it, or when it is fled through by a friendly unit with the Peasantry special rule.


A unit with this Chivalrous Vow cannot be joined by a character with the Peasantry special rule. A character with this Chivalrous Vow cannot join a unit with the Peasantry special rule.

Name: Engine Of The Gods
Description: Description: This model can cast Burning Alignment, with a Power Level of 3.

Name: Ark Of Sotek
Description:
Description: A Bastiladon equipped with an Ark of Sotek gains the following special rules:
Slithering Serpents
Spawn of Sotek

Name: Solar Engine
Description: Description: This model can cast Beam of Chotec with a Power Level of 2.

Name: Fireleech bolas
Description:
R: 6"
S: S+1
AP: -
Special Rules: Flaming Attacks, Move & Shoot, Quick Shot
Notes: undefined

Name: Giant blowpipes
Description:
R: 18"
S: 3
AP: -
Special Rules: Cumbersome, Multiple Shots (2D6), Poisoned Attacks
Notes: undefined

Name: Soul Of Stone
Description: Description: When rolling on the Miscast table, this character can modify the result by -1 (to a minimum of 2), or by +1 (to a maximum of 12).

Name: Higher State Of Mind
Description: Description: This character gains the Ethereal special rule.

Name: Becalming Cogitation
Description: Description: Once per turn, the Slann Mage-Priest may re-roll one of the D6 when making a Wizardly dispel attempt. In addition, this character increases their Dispel range by 3".

Name: Wandering Deliberations
Description: Description: Instead of generating spells normally, this character knows four signature spells, chosen from the following Lores of Magic: Battle Magic, Daemonology, Dark Magic, Elementalism, High Magic, Illusion and Necromancy. The character may discard one of these signature spells in favour of a spell from the Lore of Lustria (see page 21).

Name: Transcendent Healing
Description: Description: This character gains the Regeneration (5+) special rule.

Name: Sorcerous Void
Description:
Description: This character gains the Magic Resistance (-D3) special rule.

 Roll the D3 before armies are deployed.

Name: Harrowing Scrutiny
Description: Description: This character gains the Terror special rule.

Name: Wisdom of the Old Ones
Description: Description: Once per turn, the Slaan Mage-Priest may re-roll one of the D6 when making a Casting Roll. In addition, it knows one more spell (chosen in the usual way) than is normal for their Level of Wizardy

Name: Palanquin
Description: Description: This character may join a unit with the Guardians special rule despite having the Fly special rule. As long as the front rank has a minimum of 4 models they may be placed in the second rank. However, they continue to confer benefits to the unit in the form of Leadership and Special Rules. As long as this model is not in the fighting rank, they may cast and dispel as normal, even if its unit is engaged in Combat, but may not cast Assailment spells. For the purpose of shooting and casting spells, this model has a 360° vision arc and ignores models in the unit for drawing line of sight.

Name: Arcane Configuration
Description: Description: Friendly Wizards may apply a +1 modifier to any Casting roll they make whilst within 6" of an Engine of the Gods.

Name: Wizarding Hat
Description: Description: The wearer is a Level 1 Wizard and knows one randomly generated spell from a Lore of Magic of your choosing. However, the whispers of the ghostly Wizard haunting the hat are often confusing. Therefore, the wearer also becomes subject to the Stupidity special rule.

Name: Armour of Destiny
Description: Description: The Armour of Destiny is a suit of heavy armour. In addition, its wearer has a 4+ Ward save against any wounds suffered.

Name: Dawnstone
Description: Description: The bearer if the Dawnstone may re-roll any Armour Save roll of a natural 1.

Name: Bedazzling Helm
Description: Description: Models whose troop type is ‘infantry’ or ‘cavalry’ only. May be worn with other armour. The wearer of the Bedazzling Helm improves their armour value by 1 (to a maximum of 2+). In addition, any enemy model that directs its attacks against the wearer during the Combat phase suffers a -1 modifier to its rolls To Hit.

Name: Spellshield
Description: Description: The Spellshield is a shield. In addition, its bearer has a 5+ Ward save against any wounds suffered that were caused by a Magic Missile, a magical Vortex, or and Assailment spell.

Name: Armour of Meteoric Iron
Description: Description: The Armour of meteoric Iron gives its wearer an armour value of 5+, which cannot be improved in any way. However, nor can this armour value be reduced in any way either.

Name: Charmed Shield
Description: Description: The Charmed Shield is a shield. In addition, once per game the Charmed Shield gives its bearer a 5+. Ward save against a single wound. Once this Ward save has been used, the Charmed Shield is considered to be an ordinary, non magical shield.

Name: Enchanted Shield
Description: Description: The Enchanted Shield is a shield. In addition, its bearer has a 6+ Ward save against any wounds suffered that were caused by a non-magical enemy attack.

Name: Armour of Silvered Steel
Description: Description: The Armour of Silvered Steel is a suit of armour that gives its wearer an armour value of 3+ which cannot be improved in any way.

Name: Glittering Scales
Description: Description: The Glittering Scales is a suit of light armour. In addition once per turn, you may make your opponent re-roll a single roll To Hit made against the wearer.

Name: Shield of the Warrior True
Description: Description: The Shield of the Warrior True is a shield. In addition, its bearer has a 5+ Ward saved against any wounds suffered during the Shooting phase.

Name: Talisman Of Protection
Description: Description: The Talisman of Protection gives its bearer a 5+ Ward save against any wounds suffered.

Name: Paymaster's Coin
Description: Description: Single use. The bearer of a Paymaster's Coin can re-roll any failed rolls To Hit made during the Combat phase.

Name: Obsidian Lodestone
Description: Description: A model may purchase up to three Obsidian Lodestones. A model that bears a single Obsidian Lodestone has magic Resistance (-1), a model that bears two has Magic Resistance (-2), and a model that bears three has a Magic Resistance (-3).

Name: Luckstone
Description: Description: Single use. The bearer of a Luckstone can re-roll a single failed Armour Save roll.

Name: Banner of Iron Resolve
Description: Description: A unit carrying the Banner of Iron Resolve gains the Stubborn special rule.

Name: Razor Standard
Description: Description: A unit carrying the Razor Standard gains the Armour Bane (2) special rule.

Name: Rampaging Banner
Description: Description: When a unit carrying the Rampaging Banner declares a charge, it may re-roll its Charge roll.

Name: War Banner
Description: Description: When calculating its combat result, a unit carrying the War Banner may claim an additional bonus of +1 combat result point.

Name: The Blazing Banner
Description: Description: A unit carrying the Blazing Banner gains the Flaming Attacks special rule.

Name: Flying Carpet
Description: Description: Models whose troop type is 'regular infantry' or 'heavy infantry' only. The bearer of the Flying Carpet gains the Fly (8) and Swiftstride special rules. However, the bearer cannot join a unit.

Name: Healing Potion
Description: Description: Single use. During the Command sub-phase of their turn, the bearer of a Healing Potion can consume it. The model immediately recovers 1D3 lost Wounds.

Name: Potion of Strength
Description: Description: Single use. During the Command sub-phase of their turn, the bearer of a Potion of Strength can consume it. Until the end of that turn, the model has a +D3 modifier to its Strength characteristic (to a maximum of 10).

Name: Potion of Foolhardiness
Description: Description: Single use. During the Command sub-phase of their turn, the bearer of a Potion of Foolhardiness can consume it. Until the end of that turn, the model gains the Immune to Psychology special rule.

Name: Ruby Ring of Ruin
Description: Description: The wielder of the Ruby Ring of Ruin can cast the Fireball spell from the lore of Battle Magic as Bound spell, with a Power Level 2.

Name: Potion of Speed
Description: Description: Single use. During the Command sub-phase of their turn, the bearer of a Potion of Speed can consume it. Until the end of that turn, the model has a +D3 modifier to its Initiative characteristic (to a maximum of 10).

Name: Potion of Toughness
Description: Description: Single use. During the Command sub-phase of their turn, the bearer of a Potion of Toughness can consume it. Until the end of that turn, the model has a +D3 modifier to its Toughness characteristic (to a maximum of 10).

Name: Feedback Scroll
Description: Description: Single use. The bearer may use this scroll instead of making a Wizardly dispel attempt. The spell is cast as normal. Once the spell has been resolved, roll  2D6. For each roll of a 4+, the casting Wizard loses a single Wound.

Name: Scroll of Transmogrification
Description:
Description: Single use. The bearer may use this scroll instead of making a Wizardly dispel attempt. The spell is cast as normal. Once the spell has been resolved, the casting player must roll equal to or lower than the casting Wizard's Level of Wizardry on a single D6. Should they fail, the Wizard turn into a frog.

Whilst transmogrified, the Wizard cannot cast or dispel any spells, cannot use any of their equipment (magical or mundane) and reduces all of their characteristics (excluding Wounds) to 1. During each Start of Turn sub-phase, a player may roll a D6 for each transmogrified Wizard in their army. On a roll of 4+, the Wizard returns to normal.

Name: Arcane Familiar
Description: Description: The owner of an Arcane Familiar knows spells from two Lores of Magic, rather than the usual one. When determining the spells the Wizard knows, you must roll for each Lore separately. Duplicate spells are re-rolled as normal. The Wizard may discard one randomly generated spell as normal, replacing it with the signature spell of the same Lore of Magic.

Name: Wand of Jet
Description: Description: The bearer of the Wand of Jet may apply a +1 modifier to any of their Casting or Dispel rolls. However, should they roll any natural double when making a Casting or Dispel roll, the Wand of Jet is destroyed and it cannot be used again.

Name: Earthing Rod
Description: Description: Single use. Should they miscast a spell, a Wizard can use the Earthing Rod to re-roll the result rolled on the Miscast table.

Name: Dispel Scroll
Description: Description: Single use. A wizard may use this scroll when attempting a Wizardly dispel. If they do so, roll an extra D6 when making the Dispel roll and discard the lowest result. However, if a double 1 is rolled on any two of the dice rolled, the Wizard is outclassed in the art.

Name: Power Scroll
Description: Description: Single use. A Wizard may use this scroll when attempting to cast a spell. If they do so, roll an extra D6 when making the Casting roll and discard the lowest result. However, if a double 1 is rolled on any two of the dice rolled, the spell is miscast.

Name: Gilded Cuirass
Description: Description: The Gilded Cuirass is a suit of heavy armour. In addition, its wearer has the [Regeneration (5+)] special rule.

Name: Armour of the Damned
Description: Description: The Armour of the Damned is a suit of full plate armour. In addition, during the Combat phase, enemy models must re-roll successful rolls To Hit made against the wearer.

Name: Crimson Armour of Dragon
Description: Description: Models whose troop type is 'infantry' or 'cavalry' only. The Crimson Armour of Dragon is a suit of heavy armour. In addition, the wearer is immune to the Multiple Wounds special rule. If the wearer suffers an unsaved wound from an attack with this special rule, they lose a single Wound.

Name: Brazen Collar
Description: Description: The wearer of a Brazen Collar has Magic Resistance (-2).

Name: Crown of Everlasting Conquest
Description: Description: The wearer of the Crown of Everlasting Conquest gains the Regenerate (5+) special rule.

Name: Banner of the Gods
Description: Description: A unit carrying the Banner of the Gods ignores all negative modifiers to its Leadership characteristic.

Name: Banner of Rage
Description: Description: A unit carrying the Banner of Rage gains the Frenzy special rule. However, unlike other Frenzied units, this unit cannot lose this special rule.

Name: Blasted Standard
Description: Description: A unit carrying the Blasted Standard may re-roll any rolls of a natural 1 when making an Armour Save roll against wounds suffered during the Shooting phase.

Name: Doom Totem
Description: Description: All enemy units that can draw a line of sight to the model carrying the Doom Totem suffer a -1 modifier to their Leadership characteristic.

Name: Wraithstone
Description: Description: Unless the bearer of the Wraithstone is fleeing, enemy units suffer a -1 modfifier to their Leadership characteristic (to a minimum of 2) whilst within 6" of the bearer.

Name: Pendant of Damnation
Description: Description: Models whose troop type is 'infantry' or 'cavalry' only. The bearer of the Pendant of Damnation gains a +1 modifier to their Attacks characteristic for every Wound they lose.

Name: Favour of the Gods
Description: Description: Single use. The bearer of a Favour of the Gos may re-roll the D6 when rolling on the Gaze of the Gods table.

Name: Helm of Many Eyes
Description: Description: The helm of Many Eyes gives its wearer (but nor their mount) the Strike First special rule. However, due to the combining images the helm conjures up, its wearer is also subject to the Stupidity special rule.

Name: Skull of Katam
Description:
Description: The bearer of the Skull of Katam and any other Wizard within 3" (friend or foe) may apply a +1 modifier to any Casting roll they make.

Note that this is a modifier to the result of a roll - it does not negate a roll of a natural double 1.

Name: Spell Familiar
Description:
Description: 0-1 per Wizard. The owner of a Spell Familiar knows one more spell (chosen in the usual way) than is normal for their Level of Wizardry.

Note that this does not increase the Wizard's Level.

Name: Infernal Puppet
Description: Description: Unless the owner of the Infernal Puppet is fleeing or engaged in combat, they may use it whenever an enemy Wizard that is within 24" of them makes a Casting roll. If they do so, the enemy Wizard must roll an extra D6 and discard the highest result.

Name: The Blackened Plate
Description: Description: The Blackened Plate is a suit of full plate armour. In addition, its wearer has a 3+ Ward save against any wounds suffered that were caused by an attack that has the Flaming Attacks special rule.

Name: Pelt of the Dark Young
Description: Description: May de worn with other armour. The wearer if the Pelt of the Dark Young improves their armour save by 1 (to a maximum of 2+). In addition, its wearer (and any unit they have joined) has Magic Resistance (-2).

Name: Rune of the True Beast
Description: Description: Enemy models whose troop type is 'monster' suffer a -1 modifier to their Weapon Skill characteristic whilst within 6" of the bearer of the Rune of the True Beast.

Name: Dark Heart
Description: Description: Single use. During the Command sub-phase on their turn the bearer of the Dark Heart can consume it. The model immediately recovers one lost Wound.

Name: Totem of Rust
Description: Description: Every model (friend or foe) within 6" of the model carrying the Totem of Rust suffers a -1 modifier to its Armour Save rolls.

Name: Standard of the Cursing Word
Description: Description: Battle Standard Bearer only. At the end of any phase in which one or more models in a unit joined by the bearer of the Standard of the Cursing World lost its last Wound to an enemy attack, the unit that made the attack must make a Leadership test. If this test is failed, the enemy unit suffers D3 Strength 2 hits, each with an Ap of -, for each model that lost its last Wound.

Name: Banner of Outrage
Description: Description: A unit carrying the Banner of Outrage may re-roll its Leadership test when testing for Primal Fury.

Name: Vitriolic Totem
Description: Description: A unit carrying the Vitriolic Totem gains the Poisoned Attacks special rule.

Name: Manbane Standard
Description: Description: All enemy units within 6" of the model carrying the Manbane Standard suffer a -1 modifier to their Leadership characteristic (to a minimum of 2).

Name: Jagged Dagger
Description: Description: The Jagged Dagger can only be used by a Wizard that has joined a unit. Before making a Casting roll, the bearer of the Jagged Dagger may make a sacrifice. On model belonging to the bearer's unit is immediately removed from play as a casualty. The bearer may then modify their Casting roll by adding the Wounds characteristic f the sacrificed model to the result. Note that this is a modifier to the result of a roll- it does not negate a roll of a natural double 1.

Name: Hagtree Fetish
Description: Description: Whenever the bearer of the Hagtree Fetish successfully casts a Magic Missile, they may re-roll any failed rolls To Wound.

Name: The Plague Chalice
Description: Description: If the bearer of the Plague Chalice rolls any natural double when making a Casting roll (not including rolls of a natural double 1), the spell is cast as a perfect invocation, regardless of its casting value or of any other modifiers. However, each time the bearer casts a perfect invocation they suffer a Strength 4 hit with no armour save permitted (Ward and Regeneration saves can be attempted as normal).

Name: Stone of Spite
Description: Description: Single use. During the Command sub-phase of their turn, if they are not engaged in combat, this character may use the Stone of Spite. Until your next Start of Turn sub-phase all Wizards (friend or foe) suffer a -2 modifier to their casting rolls.

Name: Skin of Man
Description: Description: Beastman Chieftains and Beastman Shamans whose troop type is 'infantry' only. The wearer of the Skin of Men gains the Scouts and Vanguard special rules.

Name: Horn of the First Beast
Description: Description: Unless the bearer of the Horn of the First Beast is fleeing, any friendly unit that is within 18" of this model may use its Leadership characteristic when testing for Primal Fury.

Name: Helm of the Hunt
Description: Description: May be worn with other armour. The wearer of the Helm of the Hunt improves their armour value by 1 (to a maximum of 2+). In addition the wearer has a +1 modifier to both their Weapon Skill and Attacks characteristic during a turn in which they charge.

Name: Railarian's Mantle
Description: Description: Railarian's Mantle is a suit of light armour. In addition, whilst its wearer is within 6" of a woodland terrain feature, they have a 4+ Ward save against any wounds suffered.

Name: Merciw's Locus
Description: Description: The Strength characteristic of the bearer of Merciw's Locus cannot be modified by any weapon. However, the Strength characteristic of any model that directs its attacks against the bearer during the Combat phase cannot be modified by any weapon either.

Name: Glamourweave
Description: Description: Enemy models must make a Leadership test before making any rolls To Hit against the wearer of the Glamourweave during the Combat phase. If this test is failed, only rolls of a natural 6 will hit.

Name: Banner of Midsummer's Eve
Description: Description: A unit carrying the Banner of Midsummer's Eve gains the [Ignore Cover] special rule.

Name: Banner of the Eternal Queen
Description: Description: When calculating its combat result, a unit carrying the Banner of the Eternal Queen may claim an additional bonus of +1 combat result point if it is within 6" of a woodland terrain feature.

Name: Banner of the Hunter King
Description: Description: A unit carrying the Banner of the Hunter King gains the Vanguard special rule.

Name: Banner of the Wildwood
Description: Description: A unit carrying the Banner of the Wildwood gains the Fear special rule. If the unit already has the Fear special rule, it instead gains the Terror special rule.

Name: Wailing Arrow
Description: Description: Single use. Models with Asrai Longbow only. A Wailing Arrow can be fired as normal from the bearer's Asrai Longbow. A unit that suffers an unsaved wound from this shot must make a Panic test as if it had taken heavy casualties.

Name: Hail of Doom Arrow
Description: Description: Single use. Models with Asrai Longbow only. A Hail of Doom Arrow can be fired as normal from the bearer's Asrai Longbow. If the roll To Hit is successful, place a small (3") blast template so that its central hole is directly over the centre of the target unit. Any model whose base lies underneath the template risks being hit and suffering a single Strength 4 hit with an AP of -1 and the Magical Attacks special rule.

Name: Deepwood Sphere
Description: Description: Unless the bearer of the Deepwood Sphere is fleeing or engaged in combat, they may use it when an enemy Wizard that is within 6" of a woodland terrain feature succesfully casts a spell. If they do sim no dispel attempt can be made and the spell is cast as normal. Once the spell has been resolved, the enemy Wizard immediately suffers D3 Strength 4 hits each with and AP of -1

Name: Wand of Wych Elm
Description: Description: Once per turn, if they are within 3" of a woodland terrain feature, the bearer of the Wand of Wych Elm may re-roll a failed Casting roll.

Name: Oaken Stave
Description: Description: Whilst within 3" of a woodland terrain feature, the bearer of the Oaken Stave increases their Dispel range by 3". Additionally, shilst within 3"of a woodland terrain feature, the bearer may roll an extra D6 when making the Dispel roll and discard the lowest result.

Name: Armour of Caledor
Description: Description: The Armour of Caledor is a suit of full plate armour. In addition, its wearer has a 5+ Ward save against any wounds suffered.

Name: Dragon Helm
Description: Description: May be worn with other armour. The wearer of the Dragon Helm improves their armour value by 1 (to a maximum of 2+). In addition, its wearer has a 6+ Ward save against any wounds suffered that were caused by an attack that has the Flaming Attacks special rule.

Name: The Loremaster's Cloak
Description: Description: The bearer of the Loremaster's Cloak and any unit they have joined has a 4+ Ward save against any wounds suffered that were caused by a Magic Missile.

Name: Opal Amulet
Description: Description: Single use. An Opal Amulet gives its bearer a 2+ Ward save against a single wound.

Name: Banner of Arcane Protection
Description: Description: A unit carrying the Banner of Arcane Protection gains the [Magic Resistance(-3)] special rule. In addition, friendly units within 6" of the model carrying this standard gain the [Magic Resistance (-1)] special rule.

Name: Banner of Ellyrion
Description: Description: A unit carrying the Banner of Ellyrion gains the [Move Through Cover] special rule.

Name: Lion Standard
Description: Description: A unit carrying the Lion Standard automatically passes any [Fear] or [Terror] test it is required to make.

Name: Battle Banner
Description: Description: When calculating its combat result, a unit carrying the Battle Banner may claim an additional of +D3 combat result points.

Name: Null Stone
Description: Description: Whilst within the Command range of the bearer, all Wizards (friend or foe) suffer a -1 modifier to their Casting and Dispel rolls. In addition, during the Command sub-phase of their turn, if they are not engaged in combat, this character may attempt to use the Null Stone by making a Leadership test (using their own unmodified Leadership). If the test is passed, until your next Start of Turn sub-phase, this character cannot be targeted by any spells and is immune to the effect of any spell.

Name: Seed of Rebirth
Description: Description: The Seed of Rebirth gives its bearer the Regeneration (5+) special rule.

Name: The Cloak of Beards
Description: Description: The wearer of the Cloak of Beards causes [Terror]. However, so worrying is the cloak that other models cannot use the wearers Leadership.

Name: Sigil of Asuryan
Description: Description: Single use. A Wizard may use this item instead of making a dispel attempt. If they do so, the spell is automatically dispelled with no Dispel roll required. Note that a perfect invocation cannot be dispelled.

Name: Silvery Wand
Description:
Description: The bearer of the Silvery Wand knows one more spell (chosen in the normal way) than is normal for their Level of Wizardry.

Note that this does not increase the Wizard's Level.

Name: Annulian Crystal
Description:
Description: Once per turn, upon successfully casting a spell, the bearer of the Annulian Crystal can choose to forget that spell and immediately generate another (not including signature spells) in the usual manner.

Note that it is possible the Wizard might generate the spell they just forgot, or one forgotten in a previous turn. Consider it fate.

Name: Jade Amulet
Description: Description: The bearer is immune to the [Killing Blow] special rule. If the bearer is struck a [Killing Blow], they are permitted armour and [Regeneration] saves as normal. If the wound is unsaved, they lose a single Wound.

Name: The White Cloak
Description: Description: The wearer of the White Cloak has a 5+ Ward save against any wounds suffered, and a 3+ Ward save against any wounds suffered that were caused by an attack that has the [Flaming Attacks] special rule.

Name: Armour of Fortune
Description: Description: The Armour of Fortune is a suit of heavy armour. In addition, its wearer has a 6+ Ward save against any wounds suffered and is immune to the [Killing Blow] special rule. If the wearer is struck a [Killing Blow], they are permitted armour and [Regeneration] saves as normal. If the wound is unsaved, they lose a single Wound.

Name: Armour of Tarnus
Description: Description: The Armour of Tarnus is a suit of light armour which may be purchased and worn by and Imperial Wizard, even if they do not have the option to be equipped with armour, a shield or barding, without penalty. In addition, its wearer has a 5+ Ward save against any wounds suffered.

Name: Imperial Banner
Description: Description: All friendly units within the Command range of the model carrying the Imperial Banner roll 3D6 when making a [Fear], Panic or [Terror] test and discard the highest result.

Name: Banner of Duty
Description: Description: A unit carrying the Banner of Duty may re-roll any failed Rally test.

Name: The Gleaming Pennant
Description: Description: Single use. A unit carrying the Gleaming Pennant may re-roll a single failed Leadership test. Note that a Break test is not a Leadership test.

Name: Griffon Standard
Description: Description: When determining your combat result, a unit carrying the Griffon Standard can claim a Rank Bonus of +2 for each extra rank behind the first, rather than the usual +1.

Name: Glowy Green Amulet
Description: Description: If the bearer (and any unit they have joined) is the target of an enemy spell, they may use the Glowy Green Amulet instead of making a Wizardly dispel attempt. Roll a D6. On a roll of 2+, the spell is dispelled. However, if a 1 is rolled, the Glowy Green Amulet explodes. The amulet is destroyed and cannot be used again, and its bearer loses a single Wound. Note that the Glowy Green Amulet cannot be used against a perfect invocation.

Name: The Collar of Zorga
Description: Description: Any enemy ‘beast of burden’ that directs its attacks against the wearer of the Collar of Zorga or their unit during the Combat phase suffers a -1 modifier to its rolls To Hit. For the purposes of this rule, a beast of burden is the mount of any model whose troop type is ‘cavalry’, the beast(s) that draw any model whose troop type is ‘chariot’, and the mount of any mounted character whose troop type is ‘monster’.

Name: Guff's Windy Banner
Description: Description: A unit carrying the Guff's Windy Banner may re-roll any failed Panic test.

Name: Da Banner of Butchery
Description: Description: All models in a unit carrying Da Banner of Butchery have a +1 modifier to their Strength characteristic during a turn in which they charge.

Name: Waaagh! Banner
Description: Description: A unit carrying the Waaagh! Banner increases its maximum possible charge range by 3" and when it makes a Charge roll may apply a +D3 modifier to the result.

Name: The Big Red Raggedy Flag
Description: Description: A unit carrying the Big Red Raggedy Flag has a +1 modifier to its Weapon Skill characteristic (to a maximum of 10). In addition, whilst calculating its combat result, the unit may count an additional bonus of +1 combat result point.

Name: Mantle of the Damsel Elena
Description: Description: The bearer is immune to the [Poisoned Attacks] special rule. If the bearer is wounded by an attack with this special rule, the attacker must roll To Wound as normal.

Name: Sirienne's Locket
Description: Description: Models whose troop type is 'infantry' or 'cavalry' only. The bearer is immune to the [Multiple Wounds] special rule. If the bearer is wounded by an attack with this special rule, they suffer a single wound.

Name: Gromil Great Helm
Description: Description: May be worn with other armour. The wearer of the Gromil Great Helm improves their armour value by 1 (to a maximum of 2+). In addition, the wearer may re-roll any roll of a natural 1 made when making an Armour Save roll.

Name: Prayer Icon of Quenelles
Description: Description: The bearer of the Prayer Icon of Quenelles increases their Dispel range by 3". Additionally, when attempting to dispel a Hex spell, the bearer of the Prayer Icon of Quenelles gains a +1 modifier to their Dispel roll.

Name: Sacrament of the Lady
Description: Description: Single use. The bearer of the Sacrament of the Lady may use it before making a Casting roll. If they do, they may apply a +2 modifier to that Casting roll. Note that this is a modifier to the result of a roll - it does not negate a roll of a natural double 1.

Name: Silver Mirror
Description: Description: Single use. The bearer of the Silver Mirror may use it when attempting a Wizardly dispel. If they do so, roll and extra D6 when making the Dispel roll and discard the lowest result. Id a double 1 is rolled on any two of the dice rolled, the bearer is outclassed in the art and the dispel attempt fails. If the dispel attempt is successful, the spell is dispelled and the casting Wizard suffers a Strength 4 hit with an AP of -2.

Name: Gauntlet of the Duel
Description: Description: Challenges issued by the bearer of the Gauntlet of the Duel cannot be refused.

Name: Antlers of the Great Hunt
Description: Description: If the wearer of the Antlers of the Great Hunt is mounted on a Barded Warhorse or a Warhorse, they and any unit they join gains the [Move Through Cover] special rule.

Name: Falcon-horn of Fredemund
Description: Description: During the Command sub-phase of their turn, if they are not engaged in combat, this character may attempt to use the Falcon-horn of Fredemund by making a Leadership test (using their own unmodified Leadership). If this test is passed, until your next Start of Turn sub-phase enemy units cannot use the [Fly] special rule.

Name: Banner of Chalons
Description: Description: Enemy units cannot declare a Stand & Shoot charge reaction against a unit carrying the Banner of Chalons.

Name: Errantry Banner
Description: Description: All models in a unit carrying the Errantry Banner have a +1 modifier to their Strength characteristic during a turn in which they charge. However, the unit also gains the Impetuous special rule.

Name: Conqueror's Tapestry
Description: Description: Any enemy standard captured by a unit carrying the Conqueror's tapestry is worth 100 Victory points as a trophy of war.

Name: Valorous Standard
Description: Description: A unit carrying the Valorous Standard rolls 3D6 when making a Break test and discards the highest result.

Name: Armour of the Ages
Description: Description: The Armour of the Ages is a suit of light armour. In addition, enemy models must re-roll successful rolls To Wound made against the wearer.

Name: Shield of Ptra
Description: Description: The Shield of Ptra is a shield. In addition, any enemy model that directs their attacks against the bearer during the Combat phase suffers a -1 modifier to their Weapon Skill characteristic.

Name: Warding Splint
Description: Description: The Warding Splint is a suit of heavy armour which may be purchased and worn by a Liche Priest, even if they do not have the option to be equipped with armour, a shield or barding, without penalty. In addition, its wearer has a 5+ Ward save against any wounds suffered.

Name: Royal Mantle
Description: Description: The Royal Mantle may only be taken by models in a Nehekharan Royal Host Army of Infamy. May be worn with other armour. The wearer of the Royal Mantle improves their armour value by 1 (to a maximum of 2+). In addition, the wearer’s [My Will Be Done] special rule affects all friendly units with the Nehekharan Undead special rule within 6’’ of them, not just the unit they have joined.

Name: Amulet of the Serpent
Description: Description: The bearer of the Amulet of the Serpent and any unit they have joined gains the [Poisoned Attacks] special rule.

Name: Relic of The Desert Sun
Description: Description: The bearer of the Relic of the Desert Sun is not subject to the [Dry as Dust] or [Flammable] special rules.

Name: Collar of Shapesh
Description: Description: Single use. When the wearer of the Collar of Shapesh loses their last Wound, roll a D6. On a roll of 4+, the Wound is not lost. Instead, a single friendly model within the wearer’s Command range is removed from play as a casualty.

Name: Crown of Kings
Description: Description: Monarch of Nehekhara only. During the command sub-phase of their turn, if they are not engaged in combat, the wearer of a Crown of Kings may attempt to resurrect the fallen by making a Leadership test. If this test is passed, a single friendly unit of Skeleton Warriors, Skeleton Archers, Skeleton Horsemen or Skeleton Horse Archers that is within the model’s Command range Recovers D3+1 Wounds.

Name: Icon of the Sacred Eye
Description: Description: A unit carrying the Icon of the Scared Eye has a +1 modifier to its Weapon Skill characteristic (to a maximum of 10).

Name: Mirage Banner
Description: Description: Any enemy model that targets a unit carrying the Mirage Banner during the Shooting phase suffers an additional -1 To Hit modifier.

Name: Banner of the Desert Winds
Description: Description: Models whose troop type is ‘infantry’ only. A unit carrying the Banner of the Desert Winds gains the [Vanguard] and [Reserve Move] special rules.

Name: Tapestry of Conquered Lands
Description: Description: Any enemy standard captured by a unit carrying the Tapestry of Conquered Lands is worth 100 Victory Points as a trophy of war.

Name: Icon of Rakaph
Description: Description: Unless making a charge move, a unit carrying the Icon of Rakaph may perform a single free reform at any point during its movement.

Name: Sigil of Centuries
Description: Description: All enemy units within 6’’ of the model carrying the Sigil of Centuries suffers a -1 modifier to their Initiative characteristic (to a minimum of 1).

Name: Royal Standard Of Settra
Description: Description: The Royal Standard of Settra may only be taken in a muster list that includes Settra the Imperishable and /or Nekaph Emissary of Settra. A unit carrying the Royal Standard of Settra gains the [Hatred] (enemy characters) and [Terror] special rules.

Name: Cloak of the Dunes
Description: Description: Models whose troop type is ‘infantry’ only. The wearer of the Cloak of the Dunes gains the [Fly (9)] special rule. In addition, any enemy unit the wearer moves over during the Remaining Moves sub-phase suffers D6 Strength 2 hits, each with an AP of -1.

Name: Death Mask of Kharnutt
Description: Description: The wearer of the Death Mask of Kharnutt gains the [Terror] special rule.

Name: Icon of Rulership
Description: Description: Models whose troop type is ‘chariot’ only. This model doubles its Unit Strength, from 3 to 6. In addition, any Impact Hits caused by this model have an Armour Piercing characteristic of -2 and the [Magical Attacks] special rule.

Name: Scarab Brooch
Description: Description: When using the From Beneath the Sands special rule a summoned unit can be placed on the battlefield anywhere completely within 18’’ of a Liche Priest wearing the Scarab Brooch, rather than the usual 12’’.

Name: Enkhil’s Kanopi
Description: Description: Single use. During the Command sub-phase of their turn, if they are not engaged in combat, the bearer of Enkhil’s Kanopi may attempt to unleash its contents by making a Leadership test (using their own, unmodified Leadership). If this test is passed, all ‘Remains in Play’ spells currently in play are dispelled, including spells cast by friendly Wizards.

Name: Hieratic Jar
Description: Description: Single use. During the Command sub-phase of their turn, if they are not engaged in combat, the bearer of a Hieratic Jar can release the power held within it. The bearer may attempt to resurrect the fallen by using the [Arise!] Special rule twice during this Command sub-phase (rather than the usual once).

Name: Laurels of Victory
Description: Description: When determining your combat result, each unsaved wound caused by an attack made by the bearer of the Laurels of Victory (but not their mount) is worth 2 combat result points, rather than the usual 1.

Name: The Silver Horn
Description: Description: Characters with the Swiftstride special rule only. The bearer of the Silver Horn (and any unit they have joined) may re-roll the D6 when using the Swiftstride special rule.

Name: Shroud of Iron
Description: Description: The bearer of the Shroud of Iron (and any unit they have joined) has a 6+ Ward save against any wounds suffered that were caused by a non-magical template.

Name: Book of Ashur
Description: Description: The bearer of the Book of Ashur increases their Dispel rangeby 3" and, unless they roll any natural double, may apply a +1modifier to any of their Casting or Dispel rolls. However, ifthe bearer rolls any natural double when making a Casting orDispel roll, the book has proven to be a poor reproduction,full of glaring errors, and the +1 modifier cannot be applied tothat roll.

Name: Wizard's Familiar
Description: Description: 0-1 per Wizard. The owner of a Wizard’s Familiar may apply a +1 modifier to any of their Dispel rolls.

Name: Wizard's Staff
Description: Description: The bearer of the Wizard’s Staff gains a +1 modifier to their Casting roll when attempting to cast an Assailment spell or a Magic Missile.

Name: Trollhide Trousers
Description: Description: May be worn with other armour. The wearer of the Trollhide Trousers improves their armour value by 1 (to a maximum of 2+). In addition, their wearer has the Regeneration (5+) special rule.

Name: Armour of Mork
Description: Description: The Armour of Mork is a suit of heavy armour. In addition, its wearer has Magic Resistance (-2).

Name: ’Eadbuttin’ 'At
Description: Description: An ’Eadbuttin’ ’At gives its wearer the Impact Hits (1) special rule. This Impact Hit has an Armour Piercing characteristic of -2.

Name: Big Boss 'At
Description: Description: During the Command sub-phase of their turn, a character wearing the Big Boss ’At that is not engaged in combat may treat their comrades to some inspiring words by making a Leadership test (using their own Leadership). If this test is passed, until your next Start of Turn sub-phase this character and any unit they have joined gains the Unbreakable special rule.

Name: Fungus Wine
Description: Description: Night Goblin characters only. Single use. During the Command sub-phase of their turn, if they are not engaged in combat, this character may attempt to distribute Fungus Wine to a unit they have joined by making a Leadership test (using their own Leadership). If this test is passed, until your next Start of Turn sub-phase this character and any unit they have joined gains the Immune to Psychology special rule.

Name: Glittering Wotnots
Description: Description: If the bearer (or their unit) is the target of an enemy spell, they may use the Glittering Wotnots instead of making a Wizardly dispel attempt. Roll a D6. On a roll of 1-3, the Glittering Wotnots have no effect and the spell is cast as normal. On a roll of 4+, the spell is reflected back upon the caster and they (and their unit) become the target of the spell. The caster may make a Wizardly dispel attempt.

Name: Buzgob’s Knobbly Staff
Description: Description: Once per turn, the bearer of the Buzgob’s Knobbly Staff may re-roll a Casting roll.

Name: Idol of Mork
Description: Description: The bearer of the Idol of Mork increases their Dispel range by 3". Additionally, once per turn, when attempting a Wizardly dispel, the bearer of the Idol of Mork may re-roll the Dispel roll.

Name: Frostblade
Description:
R: Combat
S: S
AP: -
Special Rules: Killing Blow, Magical Attacks
Note: Any enemy model that suffers one or more unsaved wounds from the Frostblade must immediately make a Toughness test. If this test is failed, they gain the Strike Last special rule and must reduce their Initiative characteristic to 1 for the remainder of the game.

Name: Sword of Kings
Description:
R: Combat
S: S+1
AP: -1
Special Rules: Killing Blow, Magical Attacks
Note: The wielder of the Sword of Kings strikes a Killing Blow if they roll a natural 5 or 6 when making a roll To Wound, rather than the usual 6.

Name: Dreadlance
Description:
R: Combat
S: S+2
AP: -2
Special Rules: Armour Bane (1), Magical Attacks
Note: Models whose troop type is ‘cavalry’ or ‘monster’ only. The Dreadlance can only be used during a turn in which the wielder charged. In subsequent turns (or if the wielder did not charge) the model must use its hand weapon instead. The wielder of the Dreadlance may re-roll any failed rolls To Hit made whilst using it.

Name: Blood Drinker
Description:
R: Combat
S: S
AP: -1
Special Rules: Special Rules: [Magical Attacks]
Note: If the wielder of Blood Drinker causes one or more unsaved wounds during the Combat phase, they recover a single lost Wound.

Name: The Flayed Hauberk
Description: Description: The Flayed Hauberk is a suit of heavy armour which may be worn by a Wizard without penalty. In addition, its wearer has a 6+ Ward save against any wounds suffered.

Name: The Accursed Armour
Description: Description: Models whose troop type is ‘infantry’ or ‘cavalry’ only. The Accursed Armour is a suit of full plate armour. In addition, its wearer has a +1 modifier to their Toughness characteristic, but suffers a -1 modifier to their Weapon Skill and Initiative characteristics (to a minimum of 1).

Name: Crown Of The Damned
Description: Description: The Crown of the Damned gives its wearer a 4+ Ward save against any wounds suffered. However, due to the wailing of the spirits trapped within the crown, its wearer is also subject to the Stupidity special rule.

Name: Von Carstein Ring
Description: Description: Vampires only. Single use. When the wearer of the Von Carstein Ring loses their last Wound, roll a D6. On a roll of 2+, the Wound is not lost.

Name: Standard Of Hellish Vigour.
Description: Description: A unit carrying the Standard of Hellish Vigour gains the Reserve Move special rule.

Name: Banner Of The Barrows
Description: Description: Wight Lord Battle Standard Bearer only. During the Combat phase, when a unit carrying the Banner of the Barrows makes a roll To Hit, a roll of 3+ is always a success, regardless of the target’s Weapon Skill.

Name: Drakenhof Banner
Description: Description: If a unit carrying the Drakenhof Banner has the Regeneration (X+) special rule, it improves the armour value of its Regeneration save by 1.

Name: The Screaming Banner
Description: Description: When an enemy unit makes a Leadership test due to Fear caused by a unit carrying the Screaming Banner, it must roll an extra D6 and discard the lowest result.

Name: The Graven Sceptre
Description:
R: Combat
S: S+1
AP: -
Special Rules: Magical Attacks
Note: When making a roll To Wound for a hit caused with the Graven Sceptre, a roll of 4+ is always a success, regardless of the target’s Toughness.

Name: Black Hammer of Hashut
Description:
R: Combat
S: S+2
AP: -1
Special Rules: (Killing Blow), Flaming Attacks, Magical Attacks, Multiple Wounds (D3)
Note: Against models with the Flammable special rule, this weapon also has the Killing Blow special rule.

Name: Dark Maul
Description:
R: Combat
S: S
AP: -2
Special Rules: Killing Blow, Magical Attacks
Note: Any enemy model that suffers one or more unsaved wounds from the Dark Maul must immediately make a Strength test. If this test is failed, the enemy model loses an additional Wound.

Name: Dagger of Malice
Description:
R: Combat
S: S
AP: -
Special Rules: Frenzy, Hatred (all enemies), Magical Attacks
Note: Unlike other Frenzied models, the wielder of the Dagger of Malice cannot lose this special rule.

Name: Armour of Bazherak the Cruel
Description: Description: The Armour of Bazherak the Cruel is a suit of full plate armour. In addition, its wearer has the Immune to Psychology and Magic Resistance (-2) special rules.

Name: The Mask of the Furnace
Description: Description: May be worn with other armour. The wearer of the Mask of the Furnace improves their armour value by 1 (to a maximum of 2+). In addition, they have a 3+ Ward save against any wounds suffered that were caused by an attack that has the Flaming Attacks special rule.

Name: Hellshard
Description: Description: If the bearer of the Hellshard loses their last Wound to an enemy attack during the Combat phase, the unit that made the attack suffers D6 Strength 5 hits, each with an AP of -1.

Name: Mantle of Stone
Description: Description: The wearer of a Mantle of Stone has a +1 modifier to their Toughness characteristic, but a -1 modifier to their Initiative characteristic.

Name: Shroud Of The Ancestor
Description: Description: A unit carrying the Shroud of the Ancestor gains the Hatred (Dwarfs) special rule.

Name: The Lammasu’s Beard
Description: Description: A unit carrying the Lammasu’s Beard has a 6+ Ward save against any wounds suffered and gains the Magic Resistance (-2) special rule. In addition, whilst within 6" of the model carrying this standard, friendly units have a 5+ Ward save against any wounds suffered during the Shooting phase and gain the Magic Resistance (-1) special rule.

Name: Ashen Banner
Description: Description: Any enemy model that targets a unit carrying the Ashen Banner during the Shooting phase suffers an additional -1 To Hit modifier.

Name: Overseer's Sigil.
Description: Description: Whilst within 9" of the model carrying the Overseer’s Sigil, friendly units lose the Levies special rule.

Name: Obsidian Vambraces
Description: Description: The wearer of the Obsidian Vambraces has a +1 modifier to their Strength characteristic and the Magic Resistance (-1) special rule. However, if they roll a natural 1 when making a roll To Hit during the Combat phase, the gauntlets shatter into pieces and can no longer be used.

Name: Daemonic Familiar
Description: Description: Enemy models engaged in combat with the owner of a Daemonic Familiar must reduce the armour value of any Ward or Regeneration save they have by 1, to a minimum of 6+.

Name: Breath Of Hashut
Description:
Description: Single use. The Breath of Hashut is a breath weapon with the following profile:

R: N/A S: 4 AP: -2 Special Rules: Breath Weapon, Flaming Attacks, Magical Attacks

Name: Scroll Of Binding
Description: Description: Single use. A Wizard may use this scroll when attempting to cast a spell. If they do so, the Wizard rolls 3D6 when making their Casting roll (rather than the usual 2D6). However, if a double 1 is rolled on any two of the dice rolled, the spell is miscast.

Name: Daemon Flask
Description: Description: Single use. During the Command sub-phase of their turn, the bearer of the Daemon Flask may open it. When they do so, all enemy units that are within this character’s Command range must make a Panic test.

Name: Vial Of Lammasu Blood
Description: Description: Single use. A Wizard may use this item instead of making a dispel attempt. If they do so, the spell is automatically dispelled with no Dispel roll required.

Name: The Fellblade
Description:
R: Combat
S: S+3
AP: N/A
Special Rules: Magical Attacks, Multiple Wounds (D3)
Notes: Characters whose Troop Type is “infantry” only.

No armour, Ward or Regeneration saves are permitted against wounds caused by this weapon.
However, during the Command sub-phase of their turn, the wielder of the Fellblade must roll a D3. On a roll of 1, they lose a single Wound.

Name: Weeping Blade
Description:
R: Combat
S: S
AP: -2
Special Rules: Magical Attacks, Multiple Wounds (D3), Poisoned Attacks
Notes: undefined

Name: Blade Of Nurglitch
Description:
R: Combat
S: S+1
AP: -
Special Rules: Magical Attacks
Notes: Any enemy model that suffers one or more unsaved wounds from the Blade of Nurglitch must immediately make a Toughness test.
If this test is failed, they suffer a -1 modifier to their Toughness characteristic (to a minimum of 1) for the remainder of the game.

Name: Death Globe
Description:
R: 9"
S: N/A
AP: N/A
Special Rules: Magical Attacks, Move & Shoot
Notes: Single use. A model armed with a Death Globe must target a specific model within its target unit, such as a champion or a character. Make a roll To Hit as normal. If successful, centre a small (3") blast template over the target model. Any model whose base lies underneath the template must make an Initiative test. If this test is failed, they lose a single Wound

Name: Cautious Shield
Description:
Description: The Cautious Shield is a shield. In addition, its bearer may choose to wield it with two hands when their combat is chosen during Step 1.1 of any Choose & Fight Combat sub-phase.

If they do, until the end of this Combat phase it improves its armour value by 3, but their Attacks characteristic is reduced to 0.

Name: Banner Of Verminous Scurrying
Description: Description: A unit carrying the Banner of Verminous Scurrying gains the Swiftstride special rule

Name: Dwarf Hide Banner
Description: Description: A unit carrying the Dwarf Hide Banner gains the Hatred (Dwarfs) and Stubborn special rules

Name: Grand Banner Of Superiority
Description: Description: When calculating its combat result, a unit carrying the Grand Banner of Superiority may claim an additional bonus of +D3 combat result points.

Name: Storm Banner
Description: Description: Single use. A unit carrying the Storm Banner may activate it during the Command sub-phase of their turn. Until your next Start of Turn sub-phase, enemy units cannot use the Fly (X) special rule and all enemy shooting suffers an additional -1 To Hit modifier.

Name: Shadow Magnet
Description: Description: Any enemy model that targets the bearer of the Shadow Magnet or any unit they have joined during the Shooting phase suffers an additional -1 To Hit modifier.

Name: Warpstone Amulet
Description: Description: The Warpstone Amulet gives its bearer a 4+ Ward save against any wounds suffered that were caused by a nonmagical enemy attack.

Name: Brass Orb
Description: Description: Single use. Instead of attacking normally during the Combat phase, the bearer of the Brass Orb can toss it at a specific model within a unit they are engaged in combat with, such as a champion or a character. Make a single roll To Hit. If successful, the target model must make an Initiative test. If this test is failed, the target model is removed from play as a casualty

Name: Skalm
Description: Description: Single use. During the Command sub-phase of their turn, the bearer of Skalm can use it. The model immediately recovers a single lost Wound and, until your next Start of Turn subphase, has a +1 modifier to their Toughness characteristic.

Name: Skavenbrew
Description:
Description: Single use. Skaven Warlords and Skaven Chieftains only.

During the Command sub-phase of their turn, if they are not engaged in combat, this character may attempt to distribute Skavenbrew to a unit they have joined by making a Leadership test (using their own Leadership). If this test is passed, until your next Start of Turn sub-phase this character and any unit they have joined gains the Frenzy special rule.

Name: Storm Daemon
Description: Description: This model can cast Storm Daemon, with a Power Level of 1

Name: Warp Condenser
Description: Description: The bearer of the Warp Condenser increases their Dispel range by 3". Additionally, when attempting to cast a Magic Missile spell, the bearer of the Warp Condenser gains a +1 modifier to their Casting roll. Finally, should they miscast a spell, the bearer of the Warp Condenser can re-roll the result rolled on the Miscast table.

Name: Staff Of The Lost Sun (Ranged)
Description:
R: 12
S: 4
AP: -3
Special Rules: Magical Attacks, Multiple Shots (3)
Note: The Staff of the Lost Sun has two profiles, representing its use as both a combat and missile weapon.

Description:
R: Combat
S: S+1
AP: *
Special Rules: Magical Attacks
Note: *No armour or Ward saves are permitted against wounds caused by the Blade of Revered Tzunki (Regeneration saves can be attempted as normal).

Name: Shield Of The Mirror Pool
Description: Description: The Shield of the Mirror Pool is a shield. In addition, each time the bearer loses one or more Wounds to a Magic Missile, the caster suffers a single Strength 5 hit with an AP of -2.

Name: Hide Of The Cold Ones
Description: Description: May be worn with other armour. The wearer of the Hide of the Cold Ones improves their armour value by 1 (to a maximum of 2+). However, its wearer is also subject to the Stupidity special rule.

Name: Aura Of Quetzl
Description: Description: Any enemy model that directs its attacks against the bearer of the Aura of Quetzl during the Combat phase suffers a -1 modifier to its rolls To Hit.

Name: Glyph Necklace
Description: Description: The bearer of the Glyph Necklace has a 5+ Ward save against any wounds suffered and gains the Magic Resistance (-2) special rule.

Name: Jaguar Standard
Description: Description: When a unit carrying the Jaguar Standard makes a Pursuit roll, it may roll an extra D6 and discard the lowest result.

Name: Sun Standard Of Chotec
Description: Description: Enemy units cannot declare a Stand & Shoot charge reaction against a unit carrying the Sun Standard of Chotec. In addition, any enemy model that targets a unit carrying this banner during the Shooting phase suffers an additional -1 To Hit modifier.

Name: Skavenpelt Banner
Description: Description: A unit carrying the Skavenpelt Banner gains the Frenzy and Hatred (Skaven) special rules.

Name: Totem Of Prophecy
Description: Description: A unit carrying the Totem of Prophecy gains the Fear special rule.

Name: Tenderiser
Description:
R: Combat
S: S+2
AP: -3
Special Rules: Extra Attacks (+1), Magical Attacks, Multiple Wounds (D3), Strike Last
Note: -

Description:
R: Combat
S: S
AP: -1
Special Rules: Armour Bane (1), Magical Attacks, Requires Two Hands, Strike Last
Note: Emissaries of the Great Maw only. If the wielder of the Bloodcleaver causes one or more unsaved wounds during the Combat phase, they recover a single lost Wound.

Name: Thundermace
Description:
R: Combat
S: S+2
AP: -2
Special Rules: Armour Bane (1), Magical Attacks, Requires Two Hands, Strike Last
Note: Rather than attacking normally, the wielder of the Thundermace may choose to make a special ‘Thunderstrike’ attack. If they do, make a single roll To Hit. If this is successful, place a small (3") blast template so that its central hole is directly over the centre of the hit unit. Any enemy model whose base lies underneath the template risks being hit by this weapon.

Name: Skullplucker
Description:
R: Combat

Description: Description: The Gut Maw is a suit of heavy armour. In addition, for each unsaved wound the wearer causes during a Challenge, they recover a single lost Wound.

Name: Mastodon Armour
Description:
Description: The Mastodon Armour is a suit of full plate armour.

In addition, its wearer has a 6+ Ward save against any wounds suffered.

Name: Cathayan Jet Pendant
Description: Description: A Cathayan Jet Pendant gives its bearer a 6+ Ward save against any wounds suffered that were caused by a Magic Missile, a Magical Vortex, or an Assailment spell.

Name: Spangleshard
Description: Description: The Spangleshard gives its bearer a 4+ Ward save against any wounds suffered. However, if a natural 1 is rolled, the Spangleshard is destroyed and it cannot be used again.

Name: Bull Standard
Description: Description: A unit carrying the Bull Standard may re-roll any failed rolls To Wound when resolving Impact Hits.

Name: Dragonhide Banner
Description: Description: A unit carrying the Dragonhide Banner may re-roll any rolls To Hit of a natural 1. In addition, a unit carrying the Dragonhide Banner has the Flaming Attacks special rule.

Name: Rune Maw
Description: Description: When an enemy Wizard chooses a unit carrying the Rune Maw as the target of a spell, roll a D6. On a 3+, the Wizard’s controlling player must choose another target. If there is no other viable target in range, the spell cannot be cast.

Name: Cannibal Totem
Description: Description: A unit carrying the Cannibal Totem gains the Regeneration (5+) special rule, but rolls only a single D6 when making a Pursuit roll (rather than the usual 2D6).

Name: Grut’s Sickle
Description:
Description: After making a Casting roll, the bearer of Grut’s Sickle may use it to roll an additional D3 and add its result to their Casting roll. However, a single friendly model within 3" of the bearer immediately loses a single Wound.

Note that the result of this additional D3 cannot cause a miscast or a perfect invocation.

Name: Halfling Cookbook
Description: Description: The bearer of the Halfling Cookbook increases their Command range, Dispel range and the range of a single spell chosen by their controlling player (not including range ‘self ’ spells) by 3".

Name: Hellheart
Description: Description: Single use. During the Command sub-phase of their turn, the bearer of the Hellheart may consume it. When they do so, they immediately lose a single Wound. However, until your next Start of Turn sub-phase, if any enemy Wizard rolls any natural double when making a Casting roll, the spell is miscast.

Name: Fistful Of Laurels
Description: Description: Single use. The bearer of a Fistful of Laurels and their unit may re-roll the 2D6 when making a Break test.

Name: Jade Lion
Description: Description: The bearer of the Jade Lion and their unit may re-roll any failed Fear, Panic, Rally or Terror test.

Name: Daemon-Slayer Scars
Description: Description: The bearer of Daemon-slayer Scars gains the Terror special rule.

Name: Black Dragon Egg
Description: Description: Single use. During the Command sub-phase of their turn, the bearer of a Black Dragon Egg can consume it. Until the end of that turn, the model has a Toughness characteristic of 6 (which cannot be improved further) and gains noxious breath (see page 18).
